title: How to Draw a Simple Tree

steps.headline: Draw a basic tree base.
steps.description: straight lines with a wider point at the top and bottom.

steps.headline: Draw the branches at the top, connected to the wider points at the top of the tree.
Now get your green pen out and start coloring the branches!
Add swirls to make the tree look wooden and made out of natural bark.
Draw two vertical lines parallel to one another, and curved at the base.
steps.description: This will be the trunk of the tree.

steps.headline: Draw figures that resembles branches growing from the sides of the trunk.
steps.description: The branches need to be thinner than the trunk.

steps.headline: Draw the leaves collectively which grow from the branches.
steps.description: Add details like the cuts and curves of the leaves.

steps.headline: Draw rings and curves to the trunk to resemble woody texture to the trunk.
Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary sketches.

tyn: Green, brown and black colored pencils or pens. The color black is needed to trace
text: Basic Tree Draw a basic tree base. straight lines with a wider point at the top and bottom. Draw the branches at the top, connected to the wider points at the top of the tree.  Now get your green pen out and start coloring the branches! ! Add swirls to make the tree look wooden and made out of natural bark.  Color the base in brown.  Cartoon Tree Draw two vertical lines parallel to one another, and curved at the base. This will be the trunk of the tree. Draw figures that resembles branches growing from the sides of the trunk. The branches need to be thinner than the trunk. Draw the leaves collectively which grow from the branches. Add details like the cuts and curves of the leaves. Draw rings and curves to the trunk to resemble woody texture to the trunk.  Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary sketches.  Color to your liking!
sentences: Basic Tree Draw a basic tree base.
straight lines with a wider point at the top and bottom.
Draw the branches at the top, connected to the wider points at the top of the tree.
Now get your green pen out and start coloring the branches!
Add swirls to make the tree look wooden and made out of natural bark.
Cartoon Tree Draw two vertical lines parallel to one another, and curved at the base.
This will be the trunk of the tree.
Draw figures that resembles branches growing from the sides of the trunk.
The branches need to be thinner than the trunk.
Draw the leaves collectively which grow from the branches.
Add details like the cuts and curves of the leaves.
Draw rings and curves to the trunk to resemble woody texture to the trunk.
Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary sketches.
